review: Excellent experience, very friendly Dr . if you are looking for a good paediatric Dr Santhosh N is top priority I would say

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Santhosh is an Excellent personality..We have 2 kids and been visiting this Dr from past 4 years.. ** ********* *** ******* ********** *** ********** ******* ******** *********** We never had a chance of follow up visit for same illness.. Dr avoids Injections and suggests syrups..Dr is punctual and strict with time...Dr is kids friendly and Parent friendly. Dr, explains the problems in understandable manner..I recommend Dr.Santhosh to my relatives and friends and they were extremely happy as we are..I strongly recommend this DR to everyone... If you get a chance, visit him and you will get to know the quality in treatment..Thank you..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Dr Santosh is not only friendly, modest and courteous by nature *** ** **** ************** He is very sensitive while handling my son. Unnecessary tests and/or medication is not advised by him. Also he is easily available to answer our queries via email. He always reverts to email queries at the earliest. Also if we walk in to his clinic he does take time to consult us and not send us back stating that we came in without appointment. He is patient in listening to our queries and responds to our concerns to our satisfaction. One of the key qualities  of Dr Santosh is he examines the babies on his own and doesn't have staff to examine. By this, a parent is sure that baby is in safe hands. 
For all these reasons I consult Dr Santosh eventhough I have to travel from whitefield to BTM every month.

tags: None
review: We have been consulting him since 7 years a doctor who keenly diagnoses listens to his patients patiently and prescribes the right medicines , he is well updated so understands the new medical innovations and it waa he who put in his full efforts to treat my children affected by dengue my son again got dengue last year and second time is dangerous but we were in his safe hands he will visit his hospital patients late night, on weekends. I also goto sagar just because he is there, very friendly and kind.

tags: None
review: Visited the clinic in btm for my kid's diarrhea. He prescribed minimal medicine which is good. But since the diarrhea worsened by next day, visited him in appolo cradle next day. As new parents we were panicked by the severe diarrhea for a 6 months baby. When conveyed it to doctor, instead of giving assurance doctor shouted at me saying how can you expect it to control in 1 day. May be he is right but as a new mother I was worried and that was not the response I expected. As a doctor he should tell if the kid is fine , instead he was asking wether to admit her or not. If situation is worse, suggest to admit else please give proper guidance so that the parents take care at home. Finally kid was admitted for one day and the diarrhea was half controlled. Next day rounds doctor comes n says I'll observe her for one more day though the kid was much better n could be taken care at home. After saying will take care at home, he says to discharge. Parents rely on doctor review completely and will be tensed when the kids are sick. Please don't admit them unless actually required. Also doctor asked to avoid sugar in food but suggested to feed nestum rice which has sugars in it. But he prescribed minimal medicine n let the child recover which is good.
reply_text:
Your feedback is confusing!
Anyways I never shouted at you for your kind information but only said that it will gradually improve over a period of 3-5 days and not one day!
As  some first time parents are  very very anxious and not confident in taking care of babies at home we suggest admission so baby does not get dehydrated.
Nestum rice is starch or rice powder and has complex sugars not sucrose or lactose which can cause diarrhoea hence told you to give it to the child!
Inspite of proper Counselling and spending enough time parents get very very anxious!
Anyway thanks for saying your child got better with minimal medications !

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: Super  in recognising of problem with which patient comes good treatment  ...friendly and dedication on work

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I was recommended doctor Santosh for pediatric consultation by another well known parent. Since then we visit him regularly and are satisfied with the treatments. My children like him.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Heartbreaking Experience

It was a bad experience with Dr. Santosh. Our baby had fever & stomach infection. ** ********** ***** *********** * warned not to breast feed for 3 days. 

Dr. Santosh diagonized & suspected Dengue/Malaria as the fever was on-off. He prescribed a blood test at Sagar Hospital & again warned not to breast feed the baby else the baby had be admitted. The blood report said no symptom of Dengue or Malaria. The blood check process at Sagar Hospital, Bannerghatta Rd was very painful for the baby. Looking at the report, Dr. Santosh very cleverly says ‚ÄúI knew there are no symptoms of Dengue or Malaria. The test was done only for our satisfaction"

Same night, we visited other child birth center. *** **** *** **** ***** ** * ***** ******** * ********* *********** There was no need for blood test, stop breast feed & antibiotic.

Duty Dr. asked to start the breast feeding immediately & to stop the antibiotic. *** **** ********* ****** *** **** *** **** *** ** ********** ***** ********** ** ********** ****** **** **** our baby is fit & fine.

Time to say goodbye Dr.!!
reply_text:
First of all dengue fever and viral fever can present with various symptoms and signs,you had come to me with your child with fever got 5-7days and loose motions not getting better for the same period!
The protocol is to investigate which I did and did rule out dengue and malaria !
The protocol to manage a child with prolonged diarrhoea with severe anal excoriation is to stop milk and sugar in diet for a temporary period of 2-3 days due to lactose and sucrose intolerance which gets better automatically better after stopping it and allows the intestine to recover and start producing lactase and sucrase enzymes for digesting sugar and milk later.
Rashes may have developed due to viral fever itself which would have got better spontaneously in a day!
Your suggestion that all symptoms getting better is within 24 hopes is a story difficult to believe as symptoms would have got better anyway in 3-5 days after seeing me!
Antibiotic was prescribed on your second or third visit in 4 days when you had shown me the blood reports and stool reports .
I cannot imagine a duty doctor telling you that it was a wrong diagnosis and management was wrong as they need hell lot of experience to learn the various intricacies in treatment and diagnosis of various conditions in children.
Your story of symptoms getting better within 24 hours is hardly believable as whatever treatment given was apt according to protocol.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: very bad experience. *** ****** ** **** ***** ******* *********** ****** Doesn't bother to listen to problems. ** ***** *********** ********* *** ***** , nothing of which helped and everything costed around 10k. We went  for our 5 years kid stomach pain. ******* * ********** ****** *******

tags: None
review:
He is quite an experienced man with a good heart who doesn‚Äôt concentrate only on the time is money concept unlike other doctors. He takes his time to understand and hear from the parents and guides perfectly well.
¬†He takes proper care of babies and has patience and answers all questions. He is a doctor who cares a lot for children... Only One thing doctor if I have a Query how do I call u or reach you as there is no phone number available in the prescription apart from Sagar hospital.

tags: None
review:
Doctor Santosh N is one of the most comprehensive kids health doctor we have in south Bangalore.  Some points on doc...

1. Values appointment time.
2. Most of the time his diagnosis is ******** *** verified by tests if warranted.
3. Guides parents, assesses quickly and follow up is easy. Available at his clinics and at Sagar Appollo if needed. 
4. We have been visiting him for almost 10 years for both of our kids.
5. If kids feel sick they tell us "Mom/Dad let's go to Santosh" !

tags: Doctor friendliness,Wait time,

I would definitely encourage to consult him and am sure your kids are in safe hands.

review: We have been seeing Dr Santosh for my child for over 2 years now. He is very humble, polite, responsive & explains the reason for all ailments & medicines. My child recovers within couple of days by his medicines. He even gives us tips for how we can bring out the best in our child. I am surprised to see negative reviews for him as for us he has been a wonderful doctor! Even my kid loves to meet him due to his pleasant demeanour.

review:
we had delivery at apollo cradle and baby was preterm with 1.8kg ,beginning he had breathing problem later in week we got know he has coarctation of aorta and some problem with heart as dr.sathosh informed us as he got know and regardless of hospital dr suggested us to relevant dr and hospital for further surgery ,and dr made sure to  get surgery  for baby with 2 days and good care in other hospital .

dr presence and immediate action towards problem and made us to understand the situation and move further made our baby life move .
thanks to dr.santhosh for his continuous support .

tags: None
review:
I am visiting this Dr. Santosh for the paediatric needs of both my kids. He listens to your problems patiently and prescribes appropriate medicines. Almost 90% of the times the illness got cured after the first visit itself. We generally visit the clinic at his house in BTM.
On one of the occasions another doctor has suggested us to admit our child to a hospital for vomiting and  diarrhoea. But, the illness was cured without admitting the child after getting consultation from Dr. Santosh. I strongly recommend him for your paediatric checkups.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Doc is really friendly, the way he explains the remedy for the issue is just awesome... once you start explaining he could analyze & say what's the exact problem...because we came across same lots of time.. I recommend Dr Santhosh to all.. 
Maximum 3 days baby will be alright... 

May some times crowd will be very high, and end up waiting long time... he just want to keep always first come, first treat types... so take that In negative way... 

Online consultation are also available... pls do visit without second thought...

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: Dr Santhosh has been very much helpful and magnanimus pediatric consultant in curing my twin baby girls 1 & 2. They were premature born @ 34 week and was undergoing treatment under his observation in NICU. He explained in layman terms about baby conditions and kept informed us about baby progress. All the daignostics, scan, xray, nursing and   intensive care all been well informed and made me understand the neccassities of it. He gave us hope and shed light on babies health. Currently we are consulting him for vaccination and polios, monthly check ups etc. We really appreciate and thankful for his attension and care for our baby. He is very much committed prefessional and I admire for his medical ethics and dedication in treating patiants.

No explanation of the medicine
No explanation of the problem why it happened

reply_text:
For your kind information I was seeing the chest X-ray of a sick neonate in the NICU which was critical on ventilator fighting for his life and giving orders to my duty doctor in the nicu.
I found that more emergency than your child at that point.
Needless it‚Äôs ok with me and anyway I would have explained everything in detail about your child before you left and if you had any doubt you could have always come back and asked me for an explanation if you didn‚Äôt understand !
You can still come back and ask me in the opd tomorrow will explain in detail !
 I don‚Äôt share my phone or WhatsApp to patients so my communication on phone is only for hospital emmergencies.
Thank you

review: I am mother of 9 months old. We waited for more than 45 mins. We went to this doctor Santosh by seeing practo reviews. *** ** ******* **** *** ** ****** **** *** *********  ***** **** **** * ************* Please don't take your babies to this doctor. Very rude *** ***********  Just asked about the mandatory vaccines and he started to shout at me. So we had to come back from him. ***** **** ***** ** *** ******
reply_text:
You were the most meanest ,rudest  patient I have seen in my entire 25yrs career who was not ready to listen to the important vaccines like typhoid vaccine to be given to children.
For your kind information it is on IAP schedule of immunisation and it is my duty to tell and advice you for which you were not ready to get educated and listen. It is your wish whether to give or not but it was rude of you to pluck the card from me which annoyed me when I was explaining.
All the best  for you !
I don‚Äôt need a certificate from the rudest person I have ever seen in my life!

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,
review: We have been consulting Dr. Santosh for our kids since they were born. We noticed that his diagnosis is very fast and accurate. Based on our experience, he is not only a very good neonatal intensive care specialist, but also, an excellent pediatrician. He was kind enough even to respond to our queries via email when we requested for his opinion.

tags: None
review: Dr Santosh is very good at his treatment but he is very money minded. For ex: for followup also he will charge money. Imagine consultation fees for children he is charging Rs.400, With in one week, if we visit again he will charge again Rs 400.  I am writing this review not against Doctor. He is very good at his work. My only concern is about the consultation fees. Thanks for understanding me.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: I visited doctor santhosh for a general check up of my 3 week old baby. Not satisfied with the approach. He suggested that the weight of the baby wasn't up to mark. He didn't ask for baby poop count or pee count. He didn't ask for lowest weight of baby. Just said everyday baby needs to gain weight of 30 grams from day 1. ** ************* ********** ******* *** *** ***** Glad to not have gone with this approach. Months into exclusive breastfeeding baby is doing better than expected.
reply_text:
I wouldn‚Äôt have prescribed formula feeds if the weight was not satisfactory.
Everybody knows that weight loss happens in the first 10 days and then weight increases and whatever was the weight at the time of examination must have been less than expected so suggested formula feeds.
The average weight gain per day is 25-30 gm per day for your kind information.
Poop count and urine output are other factors too but weight answers all questions at 3weeks of age.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: *** ****** ******* Went Vaccination of my daughter and the schedule had three vaccines but he denied to give all three stating that please come after 2 weeks for another shots all that will have an separate consultation charges. My elder daughter got all the three shots in the scheduled date only. Not at all satisfied with the visit
reply_text: Latest guidelines suggest not to vaccinate more than two at a time. Immune response is staggered and won‚Äôt benefit your child and beats the very purpose of vaccination. As a senior clinician I request you to kindly choose your words of feedback. Coming to separate consultation charges it is all a part of the system.

review: Please try to take patients on time as per their appointment time. Door should be close when talking with doctor
